item.title: Orcs Must Die! Deathtrap coming to PS5 on July 29
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/orcs-must-die-deathtrap-coming-to-ps5-on-july-29

  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Physical edition due out on September 23.

Robot Entertainment will release a PlayStation 5 version of action tower defense game Orcs Must Die! Deathtrap on July 29, the developer announced.

Ocrs Must Die! Deathtrap first launched for Xbox Series and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on January 28.

A physical edition distributed by Skybound Games will also be available for both PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series on September 23, which includes the base game, mini art book, and redemption codes for the downloadable content “Supporter Pack” and the digital soundtrack.

Here is an overview of the game, via Robot Entertainment:

About

In this thrilling new chapter of the critically acclaimed Orcs Must Die! franchise, players can fight solo or with up to four players in action-packed third-person gameplay. As brand-new War Mages, players will evolve through roguelite progression, enhancing their unique abilities to eviscerate, incinerate and obliterate massive hordes of relentless orcs.

Offering adaptive difficulties based on the number of players, Orcs Must Die! Deathtrap lets players choose from six War Mages, each with their own playstyles, personalities, traps and abilities. Finding synergies between them, maximizing their kit and tailoring playstyles is key to successfully smashing orcs.

Each intensifying wave of enemies is bolstered with randomized buffs and debuffs. Utilizing the environment, while factoring in weather and time of day will be key in pushing back against the growing hordes. As the buffs and debuffs grow, players can choose to fight on or return to their castle hub to power their hero, weapons, and traps before facing a formidable Orc General in a brutal boss fight.

Key Features

  • Fantastically Powerful Heroes – Find your role among new War Mages, each with unique weapons, abilities, traps, and personality. Each hero is tailored to different play styles and can operate independently or work together with complementing heroes, ensuring versatile and mighty orc-smashing.
  • Slay More, Alone or Together – Enjoy the game solo or in cooperative teams of up to four players—each option provides unique challenges and rewards. The game is designed to adjust to the number of players, ensuring a balanced and exciting contest in any combination.
  • No Two Runs are the Same – Face intensifying waves of orcs and other hideous beasts with randomized buffs and debuffs that impact your hero, traps, weapons, stats, and the levels themselves. Environmental factors like weather and time of day further influence enemies and your defensive options. As these buffs and debuffs stack, choose to push forward against the growing hordes or return to your castle hub to power up your hero, weapons, and traps before facing a formidable Orc General in a brutal boss fight.
  • Epic Combat – Experience enhanced combat where the combination of heroic prowess and ingenious traps leads to unparalleled orc destruction. Engage in tight, responsive third-person shooter and melee combat. Enjoy crazy physics-based interactions and ridiculous ragdoll effects. Watch with joy as your traps hurl, crush, slice, and incinerate orcs in spectacular fashion.
  • Classic Orcs Must Die! Vibe – Orcs Must Die! Deathtrap stays true to the beloved humor, personality, and charm of the series. From witty orc chatter to over-the-top physics sending screaming orcs flying, and a strong guitar- and drum-heavy soundtrack, every moment is crafted to keep your adrenaline pumping.

Watch a new trailer below.

PlayStation 5 Announce Trailer

item.title: Wizard of Legend II launches June 12 for PS5, Xbox Series, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/wizard-of-legend-ii-launches-june-12-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-pc

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Currently in Early Access for PC.

Roguelike action game sequel Wizard of Legend II will leave Early Access and launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on June 12, publisher Humble Games and developer Dead Mage announced.

Wizard of Legend II first launched in Early Access for PC on October 3, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Humble Games:

About

After being in Early Access since October 2024, the 1.0 version of Wizard of Legend II will come to PC, PlayStation, and Xbox adding new content like the Chaos Biome, Chaos minibosses, and a formidable Final Boss. Players can also master 12 new Chaos Arcana, discover 10 new relics, and take on fresh objectives with new contracts. With expanded multiplayer options for local and online co-op, the update builds on the fast-paced, spell-based combat, offering an even more vibrant, action-packed world.

Features Added Since Early Access

  • Four-Player Cooperative Play – Team up with friends in seamless online or local multiplayer, supporting up to four players. Online and local cooperative gameplay has been enhanced with better responsiveness for Arcana abilities, refined camera behavior, multiplayer boss HP adjustments, and smoother item selection to reduce accidental purchases, resulting in a more gratifying co-op experience.
  • Chaos Biome and New Challenges – The addition of the Chaos Biome introduces fresh environments, new minibosses, and a formidable Final Boss, providing dynamic combat encounters and serving as the ultimate trial.
  • Master Elemental Arcana – Players can master the element of Chaos with 12 new Arcana, offering additional magical powers and new strategies to explore.
  • New Contracts – Take on a brand new batch of objectives with new contracts, earning rewards as you progress.
  • Sky Citadel Content Update – The Sky Citadel content update introduced a new biome with 12 new enemies, including the Royal Spear Knight miniboss and the King and Queen boss. Along with the return of Dash Arcana, including 15 Arcana options, two new NPCs, improved boss behaviors, updated dialogues and voice lines, enhanced customization, local co-op improvements, and numerous balance changes.
  • Gameplay Improvements – Thanks to player feedback, the team has implemented several quality-of-life improvements since Early Access, including numerous fixes and tweaks to enhance gameplay, such as smoother local and online co-op, bug fixes for Arcana and Relic interactions, better boss behavior, and refined level designs. Adjustments also addressed UI issues, menu improvements, and balance changes to ensure a more polished and enjoyable experience.
  • Expanded Language Support – Wizard of Legend II supports a wide array of languages including Brazilian Portuguese, Chinese, French, German, Japanese, Korean, Polish, Russian, Spanish, and Turkish, expanding accessibility for players worldwide.

item.title: SOMA for Switch debut trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/soma-for-switch-debut-trailer

  • Switch

Switch version coming soon.

Abylight Studios and Frictional Games have released the first trailer for the Switch version of horror game SOMA, which was first announced back in January.

Here is an overview of the game, via Abylight Studios:

Originally developed by the masterminds at Frictional Games, this critically acclaimed science-fiction horror masterpiece is making its way to Nintendo‘s hybrid console, meticulously optimized to deliver an uncompromised experience. Get ready to question reality and survive a nightmare unlike any other.

Dive headfirst into PATHOS-II, a desolate underwater research facility where the lines between human and machine blur. As you explore the eerie, submerged corridors under the Atlantic Ocean, you’ll be thrust into a fight for survival against a hostile world that forces you to confront the very nature of consciousness and what it truly means to be human. SOMA is renowned for its profound narrative and unsettling atmosphere, earning a formidable Metacritic score of 84 and cementing its place as a genre-defining psychological thriller.

Abylight Studios has worked to ensure that this Nintendo Switch version of SOMA is a full, faithful adaptation. Experience the terrifying world of SOMA with optimized performance, stunning visuals, and the immersive sound design that made the original a sensation, now playable wherever you go. SOMA will be compatible with Switch 2.

SOMA is currently available for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG.

A release date for the Switch version of SOMA has yet to be announced.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: Kemono Teatime adds Switch version, delayed to September
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/kemono-teatime-adds-switch-version-delayed-to-september

  • PC
  • Switch

No longer due out this spring.

Cafe management ASMR game Kemono Teatime will launch for Switch and PC via Steam in September, a delay from its previously planned spring release window, developer Studio Lalala announced. The Switch version is newly announced. The game will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

Here is an overview of the game, via Studio Lalala:

A Kemomimi Cafe ASMR Adventure

Relax in this world where animal ears are a normal part of everyday life. Here in Melodius, you can whip up whatever blends of tea you desire in your favorite cafe as you play through an adorable story. Come now and live out your bestest and cutest life—down to the last drop. Though, you do know that once it’s run out, that’s it, right? It’d do you best to learn that all good things come to an end.

Meet all the Kemomimis that come through the cafe and help them wind down, spend a cute and adorable time sipping on some tea, and come to terms with their ultimate fates.

Tea-Making Simulator

Create your own unique teas with our stock of 9 black teas, 15 herbs, and 6 secret ingredients. Get to know the customers and make them something that they’ll love while you immerse yourself in the wonderful sounds of the tea-making process.

The Kemomimi Customers

All the customers have animal ears! Please savor each encounter and goodbye while you can—You’re sure to have a very special and unforgettable time here with all the people you meet.

Featuring an Homage to “Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!” by Snail‘s House as the Theme Song

The theme song for this game is an homage to daniwell’s “Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!,” made by Snail’s House with lyrics written and sung by Kotori Koiwai. In the newly released teaser trailer, you can view the short version. Immerse yourself in the KAWAII Moratorium—an escape from daily life filled with cuteness—enriched with the charm of Kemono Teatime.

  • Song Title: “KAWAII Moratorium ~Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!~”
  • Music: Snail’s House
  • Lyrics: Kotori Koiwai
  • Vocal: Kotori Koiwai

An homage to:

  • Original: “Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya!”
  • Music and Lyrics: daniwell

Staff

This game is co-produced by Fuyuki Hayashi (Studio Lalala) and voice actress Kotori Koiwai, featuring ASMR from Koiwai’s ASMR brand “kotoneiro,” with NOCO as the main visual/character designer and music provided by Snail’s House, known for their YouTube channel with over 1.3 million subscribers. This adventure game promises to deliver cute aesthetic through both visuals and audio.

  • Production: Fuyuki Hayashi / Kotori Koiwai
  • Planning and Writing: Fuyuki Hayashi
  • Direction: Fuyuki Hayashi / Takahiro Akuta
  • Programming: ART Co.,Ltd.
  • Key Visual and Character Design: NOCO
  • Pixel Art: curemoto / OYUZAKI / Sky Scraper Project / Mokuya / Akayu
  • Logo: Hiroto Sugahara
  • Music: Snail’s House
  • ASMR: kotoneiro
  • Pixel Animation: APO+
  • Animation: mamesuzu

item.title: Okayu Nyumu! sequel in development
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/okayu-nyumu-sequel-in-development

Entergram will produce a new entry in the Okayu Nyumu! romance visual novel game series starring and overseen by Hololive Virtual YouTuber Nekomata Okayu, the company announced.

Okayu Nyumu! launched for PlayStation 4 and Switch on February 27 in Japan, and is coming to PC via Steam on August 7 worldwide.

Detailed information about the new entry was not announced.

item.title: Nioh series shipments and digital sales top eight million
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/nioh-series-shipments-and-digital-sales-top-eight-million

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5

One million copies sold since October 2022.

Total worldwide shipments and digital sales for the Nioh series have surpassed eight million units, publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Team Ninja announced.

The new milestone comes two years and seven months after the series achieved seven million shipments in October 2022.

Nioh first launched for PlayStation 4 on February 7, 2017, followed by PC via Steam on November 7, 2017 and Epic Games Store on September 9, 2021. Nioh 2 first launched for PlayStation 4 on March 12, 2020, followed by PC via Steam on February 5, 2021 and Epic Games Store on September 9, 2021. A Nioh Collection including remastered versions of both games launched for PlayStation 5 on February 5, 2021.
